channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Forget quiet quitting—millennials are taking ‘quiet vacations’ and checking out of work (and the country) on company dime instead
item.description: 4 in 10 millennials take a quiet vacation—here’s how to tell if your worker is one of them

item.title: Senate GOP barely move ahead on Trump request to cancel $9 billion in approved spending but spare Bush-era HIV/AIDS program
item.description: The amount of savings pales compared to the $3.4 trillion in projected deficits over the next decade that Republicans put in motion in passing Trump's...

item.title: Home sellers are so fed up with cutting listing prices they’re just yanking their homes off the market altogether
item.description: Delistings jumped 47% year-over-year in June, according to Realtor.com.

item.title: Rising Inflation, and the Supreme Court’s ‘Shadow Docket’
item.description: Plus, why that e-book cost your library $50.

item.title: Supreme Court Keeps Ruling in Trump’s Favor, but Doesn’t Say Why
item.description: In a series of terse, unsigned orders, the court has often been giving the green light to President Trump’s agenda without a murmur of explanation.

item.title: Public Media Can Be a Lifeline. Gutting It Hurts Everyone.
item.description: Abandoning local public radio and TV would accelerate a dangerous trend straining civic health.

item.title: Afghan Women and Girls Deported From Iran Fear Returning to Afghanistan
item.description: “Get ready to cope” was the message from an aid worker to women returning to Taliban rule in Afghanistan after their expulsion from Iran.

item.title: As Iran Deports a Million Afghans, ‘Where Do We Even Go?’
item.description: Afghans being forced out of Iran are grappling with an uncertain future in Afghanistan, where widespread poverty and severe restrictions on women and ...

item.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says ‘doing our best’ to serve China after meeting Beijing officials
item.description: "They want to know that Nvidia continues to invest here, that we are still doing our best to serve the market here," he said.

item.title: ‘American Idol’ music supervisor and husband found dead at LA home, apparent victims of burglary gone wrong
item.description: An “American Idol” spokesperson confirmed the deaths of Robin Kaye and her husband, Thomas Deluca, both 70.

item.title: Afghan Women and Girls Deported From Iran Fear Returning to Afghanistan
item.description: “Get ready to cope” was the message from an aid worker to women returning to Taliban rule in Afghanistan after their expulsion from Iran.

item.title: Migration Fears Turn Europe’s Borderless Dreams Into Traffic Nightmares
item.description: Germany’s new government imposed border checks to demonstrate toughness on migration, though crossings started slowing years ago.

item.title: Why So Many Afghans Have Been Forced Out of Iran
item.description: More than 1.4 million Afghans have been forced out of Iran since January amid a governmental crackdown. Elian Peltier, an international correspondent ...

item.title: What to Know About the Fighting in Southern Syria
item.description: Druse militiamen have been fighting with Bedouins in the Sweida Province, and Syrian government forces and the Israeli military are getting involved.
